Donoghue v. Stevenson, [1932] A.C. 562.proposition: As landlord and manager of the building, Defendant owed a duty to Plaintiff and other lawful residents and invitees to maintain the common areas of the premises in a reasonably safe condition, to exercise reasonable care to discover dangerous conditions, and to repair or warn of such dangerous conditions in a timely manner.

Palsgraf v. Long Island R.R. Co., 248 N..raw_text: Palsgraf v. Long Island R.R. Co., 248 N.Y. 339 (1928)
Palsgraf v. Long Island R.R. Co., 248 N..proposition: As landlord and manager of the building, Defendant owed a duty to Plaintiff and other lawful residents and invitees to maintain the common areas of the premises in a reasonably safe condition, to exercise reasonable care to discover dangerous conditions, and to repair or warn of such dangerous conditions in a timely manner.
Palsgraf v. Long Island R.R. Co., 248 N..case_name: Palsgraf v. Long Island R.R. Co.
Palsgraf v. Long Island R.R. Co., 248 N..support_reasoning: Palsgraf concerns the scope of duty and foreseeability in negligence for a railroad’s conduct toward a passenger injured by an unforeseeable chain of events. It does not address landlord–tenant law, common areas of a building, or any specific duty of a landlord/manager to maintain, inspect, repair, or warn of dangerous conditions in common areas. Using Palsgraf to support a landlord’s premises-liability duty is therefore inapposite and misaligned with the specific proposition stated.
Palsgraf v. Long Island R.R. Co., 248 N..relevant_excerpt: “In every instance, before negligence can be predicated of a given act, back of the act must be sought and found a duty to the individual complaining, the observance of which would have averted or avoided the injury… The ideas of negligence and duty are strictly correlative… He sues for breach of a duty owing to himself.”

Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 148.proposition: Massachusetts law and applicable state and local building and fire codes impose duties on owners and managers of multi-family residential buildings to provide, install, and maintain functioning smoke detectors and fire safety devices in common areas and in a manner sufficient to provide timely warning to occupants.
